title: Maximum value of a function given its derivative

content.question: Let f be a function with derivative given by <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>8</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> for <math> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>9</mn> </mrow> </math>. At what value of x does f attain a relative maximum?

topic.text: 5.4: Using the First Derivative Test to Determine Relative (Local) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
